Reviews.Title: “Great value in Studio City”
Reviews.Author: fles44
Reviews.Content: Studio City Courtyard, formerly Days Inn, has the same attentive owners and the best value, by far. We've come twice a year for several years. Every time there's something new (furniture, air conditioner, mattress, etc.) and something being painted. It is extremely clean. Breakfast is great. The location is great,too, with easy access to all the LA and Hollywood sites.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Studio City!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lee-Anne J
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time staying at the Days Inn, which is now called the Studio City Court Yard. The owners and staff are all like family, we actually miss them when we travel back to Australia. They're always helpful and ready to do anything they can to help out. Carlos the groundsman even washed a mark off my car for me and changes the lightbulbs if they blow. If anything is wrong in your room, Carlos is the man! Gloria makes the best waffles for breakfast. Breakfast is in the office area and is the BEST!! They have waffles made fresh when you ask for them, bagels, toast, mini muffins which are delishious, apples & banana's, 3 different cereals, juices and tea and coffee. So enough to keep you going until lunch time, I always put on weight when I leave this hotel as I end up having the waffles each morning. At home I would normally only eat toast or cereal. We stay in one of the studio rooms to the left when you pull in the drive way, the rooms are huge and there is also a dressing room area, king size bed, table and chairs and a sofa & coffee table. I've had friends that stay in really expensive hotels and all they get is a small square room with a queen bed, it might be flash and made of marble but I prefer the extra space and furnisings. One thing I should mention are the beds at the Days Inn, they are seriously the best beds I've ever slept in, in the world, the mattress's are so comfy and the pillows devine, I sleep more hours here than I do in my own bed. I can't say enough about the beds, this hotel has gone out of its way to make sure they have the best in comfort. Another bonus is they have free parking and if you don't drive there is a bus line right outside Ralphs which is across the road. Ralphs is a huge supermarket. There is also alot of restaurants and shops all within walking distance. The wifi is free and super fast, much faster than our internet back in Australia. The owners are super nice people and this is definitely our number one place to stay each time we're in Los Angels recording.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: oscar888_10
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel several times when it was under the Days Inn banner, now the name is different but it remains the same, in fact it has improved several things are changing including new flat TV screen just started to be installed, service is friendly, rooms are good size and clean, I know it is not a 5 start hotel but it is good for business stays and families

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice room”
Reviews.Author: missmattie
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because it was close to a highway which meant we could get to many of the attractions in LA/Hollywood easily. The area felt safe even at night. There is a Walgreens/CVS or Ralph's in every direction from the hotel, but you definitely need a car. Room: - It was an old room but it was very well maintained and very clean - We had one king size bed which was very comfy and the housekeeping did a great job - The room is spacious, there is a separate dressing area where there is a large vanity mirror, counter space, coffee maker, fridge & lots of places to hang clothes up and store luggage. (see photos) - The TV is an older model, but it worked and we were barely watched TV anyway - Washroom is older but everything works fine - Shower head is very low. I am 5'2" and it was just right. If you're any taller than me, it's going to be a challenge to shower. - One morning we could hear the neighbour on the phone. We're not sure if it was coming through the wall or somehow through our phone - kinda wierd! Hotel Common Areas: - Parking is limited so if you are staying over a Friday or Saturday night, you might have to park on the street if you get back to the hotel late - The driveway divides the larger section of the hotel from the other side (where we stayed). I found it fairly quiet, even when there were kids in the pool or down in the courtyard. - No elevators so if you have heavy luggage (or a lot of it), request a room on the main floor - Breakfast is great! It's not extravagant but it's just right - good muffins, cereals, waffles, juice, coffee, etc. They don't have a large selection but what they have tastes good - Front Desk staff was very courteous. I had booked a non-smoking room but for some reason my reservation said smoking. When I explained it to the man at the front desk, he was more than happy to help me and tried to get me a corner room (because we were worried about noise) - If you want a late night snack, Domino's delivers and they must be close by because they brought our order in 20 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Tampa3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much while in the Los Angeles area. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. Parking is free. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed eating breakfast at the outside court yard tables with the weather being so nice. It was a safe area with drug/grocery store and restaurants near by. The Chinese Theatre was an easy drive just a few miles away. You can park there for $10 a day to take a tour or walk around. If you'd rather though Star Line Tours will pick you up at the motel. We took the Grand City Tour of Los Angeles which was an excellent 5 & 1/2 hour tour. We also went to the Sony Pictures Studios Tour. It was easy to get to by car and they have free parking. It was about a two hour walking tour and very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Teach3258
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting LA. We chose this motel because it was close to CBS Studios where we were to attend a taping. While not a brand new establishment it was very comfortable and clean. The fridge was very handy. We ate at a couple of restaurants that were close by and within easy walking distance. The breakfast although limited by some we've had suited us fine. Not a lot of choice but lots of what was there. The area was small but they have plenty of outdoor tables which were just fine. The staff was very helpful and we were pleased with our stay. For the price it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Raphael V
Reviews.Content: I was visiting LA for business. In the meantime I needed a place to be able to work and to relax. This place was great for both. Great location - just on the best part of Ventura Ave. Number of different places to eat and spend time, shops, etc. In the meantime not crowded or noisy. Hotel stuff is very professional and friendly. Nice rooms, free parking (always space available), and very good, stable internet connection. These all for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah F
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and it is in an excellent location. Close to all the wonderful dining on Ventura Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will recommend you to our friends AND we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: lynnyburch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a blast...it is located on Ventura Blvd., which has an excellent bus service up and down the street. You can shop, eat a variety of foods, and you are close to Studio City which is where Universal Studios is located. They have an outdoor pool with some palm trees around it, which my son and I enjoyed immensely. The room was classy and located near the end of the pool on the first floor, but near the parking lot at the end of the hotel, so it made it easy for us to load and unload at the end of our stay. Really an enjoyable time had by all, and the weather was gorgeous. Check this out...great time for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Great Location, Clean!”
Reviews.Author: LucyShropshire
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights during June 2011. We were travelloing around California and wanted somewhere affordable, clean and close to local attractions. This hotel was in great location close to universal studios, the hollywood sign and hollywood itself. The staff were friendly and the rooms were cleaned daily, no issues there. Included in the price of the hotel was breakfast which I did not go down to but my partner did and said that there was a good choice. The hotel was safe and provided parking for those who had a car, as we did at no extra good. Ideal place for couples, friends and families.

Reviews.Title: “Place was clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mahineLivingston
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Days Inn for 6 nights we found it quite adequate for the price. The staff was friendly. The only negative we found was a funny odor in the room. We solved this by buying a room freshener across the street at a local food store. The location was great. Most things you needed were within walking distance. The complimentary breakfast was adequate for a light bite. Coming from the East Coast, I rode down the street to a 24 hour deli for breakfast, since the Days Inn breakfast wasn't available when I woke up.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything we wanted to see.”
Reviews.Author: Mimic11
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here for two nights via their website. Good deals online when you sign up for the Rewards card. Works at several other hotels as well. Hotel is on a main street but fairly quite not much traffic noise. Has small pool for the kids in the courtyard. No hot tub which was a bit of a bummer but the pool was nice and refreshing. Hotel was under renovations when we were staying there. The contractors were painting and Gardeners replanting flowers in the courtyard. Rooms are no frills, but have all the basics. Bathrooms are very antiquated in need of new tiles and plumbing. BEWARE hot water will heat up and burn you if you are not careful it turns itself up when someone flushes the toliet or turns on the sink faucet. Pros= Close to Universal 10 minutes by car, close to Hollywood 15 minutes by car, and Santa Monica Pier 25 minutes by car. Or you can take transit bus they have routes that take you to all the tourist spots. Staff was nice, continental breakfast was a big help to get us off and running in the morning. Cons= Needs new plumbing, Carpets are filthy don't take off you socks. Overall if you need a place to stay that is not too expense close to Universal and Hollywood this hotel is worth a try as long as you keep in mind it's not the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe place at very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Aussy_10
Reviews.Content: I went there with my Family. Its a very Clean place to stay. Very close to all the attractions. Conveniently located with restaurants and Super market with in walking distance. If I visit LA again I would definitely stay at this place. Nice and polite people at Helpdesk.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: txmusicgal01
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this motel when I am in Los Angeles whether I am visiting on business or pleasure. I have been coming here for many years. The location is great as it is convenient to many businesses, including several restaurants, a bank, a gas station, a grocery store, and more, all within walking distance. The neighborhood is nice and the 101 freeway is right down the road on Coldwater. The motel itself is clean, cozy and comfortable, with a wide varitey of channels on t.v. I've stayed at 4 star hotels that don't have as good a variety of t.v. channels as this motel does. This motel also has a nice pool, great for fun and exercise. Outside the pool area, there are patio tables and chairs which are nice for visiting with family and friends. The motel staff is very accommodating and polite and ready to be of service. There is a free breakfast offered consisting of cereal, fruit, juice, coffee, toast and waffles which can be enjoyed in the small breakfast area in the lobby. There is also free parking located on the premises. Everytime my family and I visit L.A., we enjoy our stay and always look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: fabiano_ffaustino
Reviews.Content: It was the third time my wife and I spend a couple nights in this hotel, but was the first time with our children. The Hotel is ideal located close to Universal Studios as well to the famous Walk of Fame, Hollywood and Beverly Hills. We had no problems with street noise was well with cleaning stuff. Of course some pick people will may complain about the carpet cleanness, but just think, we were on vacation! Use a sandals and done! The Hotel stuff were helpful and we definitely have no complains at all. The breakfast is simple but at same time sufficient to keep you ok until lunch time. Near to the Hotel you also find restaurants, fast food chains and most of all a supermarket (Vons), really important when traveling with children! I do recommend this Hotel for people that want to enjoy outside and arenâ€™t to pick with details (for this kind of people I suggest the Hilton at Universal, that costs at least the double).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everyday hotel for business and family”
Reviews.Author: oscar888_10
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place to stay at a reasonable cost for business as well as families, no cost parking (in an area that parking is at a premium), free internet,close to excellent restaurants, good large size room with very friendly staff from top to bottom. I recommend this hotel to my friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise in Studio City”
Reviews.Author: Avatar07
Reviews.Content: I was meeting a friend of mine who lives in North Hollywood so I combined a business meeting in the Valley with some social time and checked out places to spend the night. I got a good deal at the Days Inn, right on Ventura Blvd. They were pretty full, but I got the AAA rate, which saved me 20%. When I checked in, the clerk was gracious and gave me a nice room on the 2nd floor, which was well-decorated and large. The area has plenty of restaurants and the residential area to the south of Ventura Blvd is really beautiful and filled with trees. There were only two problems with the room. The one light near the bed didn't work and the shower controls were hard to operate. They need to replace the faucets. Otherwise, it was great and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull & Helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Hanz321
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Days Inn studio city during the easter holidays with some friends. The staff were amazing and very helpfull, they went out of their way to help us book days trips and give advise on transport and dinning places. If you needed them for anything they were there within 2 minutes of ringing them from your hotel room. Was very clean and tidy. I would highly recommend this hotel, felt very comfortable and safe as this was our first holiday away from home without our parents. I cannot express into words the exellent customer service they have. Thankyou very much for a lovely stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay for those seeking a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Kayo17
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location at a lower price than other motels in the Hollywood/Burbank area Beds were wonderful - slept like a baby. Room was very clean Front desk manager was very courteous and helpful. A wonderful man! Free continental breakfast (waffles, juices, coffee, toast, cereal, muffins) Free parking. This is huge because many of the hotels in the area charge for this. Cons: The main con was the bathroom. It had no bathtub, only a shower, and seemed dated and in need of renovating (room 205). There is no exhaust fan either, so be prepared to crack the small window because the glass completely fogs up. The window also faces apartment buildings so you may not want to crack it open TOO much! It also has the electric outlet to the right of the sink, making it impossible for one to use the sink while another does their hair. It also is kind of dangerous. There is only a thin countertop to put things on as well and many cracks in wall tiles. Our room also faced the pool, which, for some reason, has a very loud motor or something that makes a loud noise. We were so tired and the beds so comfortable though, that this didn't bother us too much. All in all, it was a decent place to stay at a bargain price- comparing it to others in the area, that is. The motel is split into 2 sections- the side we were on which looks out over the pool or parking lot, and the other side which looks out over a small courtyard area. I think the courtyard section would've been a bit quieter and would specifically ask for that section if we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortable, convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fles44
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable accommodations. Always updating over the many years we have been coming: furniture, fresh paint inside and outside, air conditioning, etc. Breakfast is so good to have available. The owners are on site and took care of any request we have every the 10 or 12 years we've been coming. Very easy to get to, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeP
Reviews.Content: Probably the cosiest room from my trip. Almost a suite. Location on Ventura Bld is probably not the best there is, but insonorisation is PERFECT. Complimentary breakfast taken aside the pool area was really pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even CONSIDER staying here! RUDE beyond measure.”
Reviews.Author: WinkyBlinky
Reviews.Content: 1) EXTREMELY RUDE man who is always there. 2) Select "Dog Friendly" on their Days Inn website and this comes up- however, the rude man will SCREAM at your face that they do not allow dogs. Even if you show them ON THEIR WEBSITE that it states that they DO ALLOW DOGS, apparently he has changed his mind. Being 800 miles from home, I couldn't exactly put the dog back. He wanted me to tie my tiny little dog up to the second floor railing while I packed to leave! What???! 3) If you do leave from being screamed at, you will not get your money back from the rude man. Oh- does it say they do not charge your card until you check out? Well, too bad- they already did and there's "nothing he can do about" the other 3 nights. (Tip: Call Day's Inn for 3 weeks until you get a refund. They will try and give you a voucher, but insist on a refund. A voucher, right. Like I would stay there again. Ha ha ha. um, no) 4) Breakfast? HA! Rotten food, no tea, not much of anything. Ick. 5) Internet? It must be your fault you cannot connect. 6) Clean? Well, um, no. Not in my mind. Mold, old, gross. Shower spray at chest level. My husband didn't even try. 7) You want an ice cold pool? Sorry, not open at this time. I'm sorry it is so close to several good restaurants. Even so, I will go OUT OF MY way NOT to ever, ever stay there again. I stay in the area once a month, they lost me (& anyone else I can tell) forever. Days Inn should be aghast that their name is attached to these RUDE, RUDE people!

Reviews.Title: “Room in Need of Repair”
Reviews.Author: rmludwig
Reviews.Content: The room (#129) was comfortable but there are some serious repair issues. There was mold growing in the bathroom, the toilet was in terrible condition, painting was sloppy, wallpaper was peeling from the walls, and both faucets leaked. Looks like repairs were attempted but were very unprofessional and sloppy. The hotel building seemed well kept and the grounds looked nice. Although there seemed to be a lot of people there, the area was pretty quiet. The bed was quite nice (lots of pillows ... I think there were 5 for a king bed), the room was quiet, and the blackout curtains were great. Air conditioner worked fairly well. Wireless internet access was available but signal quality was poor. The room was very quiet. Parking is really bad. There is a lot of it but the parking area is narrow and difficult to maneuver in unless you have a small car. There is also some on street parking. Watch out for the steep dip after you pass the pool; it's difficult to see traffic coming up the hill. Lots of restaurants in the area. This is on a busy street so getting out of the driveway can be challenging. Here are photos of the problem areas in the room: http://picasaweb.google.com/rmludwig/DaysInnStudioCity?authkey=NTdoDlUbuqw

Reviews.Title: “Keep Going”
Reviews.Author: MeowMama
Reviews.Content: I was drawn to the location due to its proximity to a gathering spot with friends and family. I trusted the ratings. I should have looked elsewhere. While the room itself was ok - not great - the overall facility stank. There is no parking on the level with the rooms - so if you are disabled, forget it. The handicapped parking is down a hill - which I could not climb. The courtyard was dirty and cluttered, the vending machines were old and one was out of service. (It didn't matter to me as the front desk would not make change for a $20 to get something out of them anyway.) I needed to get a cab and the front desk person was still very sullen - of course I wasn't happy after being denied change for a cold drink. I wouldn't stay there again if they comped it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: ual95
Reviews.Content: Room is average to small. Very clean. Bathroom needs some serious updating! I mean serious! Floor was uneven and creaky. Sits on very busy Ventura Blvd so its somewhat noisy. The price was right for the area. Lots of trendy restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was a Pain!”
Reviews.Author: VacationOUTofVegas
Reviews.Content: It was a horrible stay. Checked in late--front desk guy pulled out paperwork for $150 a night. We have reservations for $89 a night. Then wanted to give us 2 queens smoking. We had reserved a King. Then wanted to give us a King Smoking....NO! We reserved a non-smoking King. Guy was a jerk. Parking is a TOTAL disaster, but we did luck out. Had to walk up the hill and quite a ways to the room. Room had new carpet, but was strangely arranged. Seemed pretty clean, BUT the security swinging lock on the door was broken off. That is one thing I like for my security. There was blood on the wall in the bath room and someones hair other than mine on the over bleached rough paper like towels they provided. We stayed two nights but I would find else where next time for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for price and area”
Reviews.Author: surpriseaztraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Days Inn - Studio City at the end of July. We were in the area for me to see a specialist, have medical tests completed, and sightsee somewhat. Our overall impression of the Days Inn is it is an older building. The desk had a bit of mix up with my reservations, but they were able upgrade my room instead. The room was old, but it was clean. The bedsheets wouldn't stay on the bed, but it is about the only complaint. The bathroom was a bit tight, but it was managable. The only major compliant I would say is the parking, but again for the price for parking (free), we worked around it. It is really seems to be safe area from the research I did on the LAPD Website, and it is very close to just about everything. Compared to other places to stay around the area, I would say this offers a good safe, quiet, clean, and economic place to stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: almontas33
Reviews.Content: Last weekend we stayed at the Days inn for 4 nights. They were horrible four nights despite the fact that we only spend a total of 8 hours on the hotel since we were always out with other friends. First of all when we reached the hotel the person checking us in was incredibly rude. 4 days later we checked out at 12noon since our plane did not leave until 5 we asked somebody in the lobby to please save our luggage for a couple of hours to which they obliged. 3 hours later we came in for our luggage and while we were waiting for our taxi to come pick us up they THREW US OUT OF THE LOBBY!!!! we told them that we were waiting to be picked up but the guy told us that this was not his problem that we were no longer guests of the hotel. Obviously he did not realize that people use the hotel more than once which I will not. I will never again stay in this hotel and neither should you. (Also they have no iron so if you are looking to iron your clothes at this hotel you are out of luck)

Reviews.Title: “great for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: dhoom
Reviews.Content: good sub 100 dollar stay in busy area of LA; typical days inn amenties in addition to wireless internet and parking; good location; 30 min from LAX in light traffic

Reviews.Title: “Questionable rates”
Reviews.Author: ReptileHunter
Reviews.Content: My husband has been staying at this location on business trips and each time is a different rate-very nice people there but need to know why rates change every week

Reviews.Title: “If you like rudeness and being charged 4 times quoted rate stay here”
Reviews.Author: carouseltravel
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this property and please look elsewhere. When I checked in I had a handicap room -( I'm in a wheelchair) which they gave me but there is no way in hell you can park a car if you are by yourself - the parking area is down an extremely steep hill behind the hotel. Even with help you couldn't push a wheelchair up the hill and would probably be killed if you tried to go down the hill in one. Also to get to the handicap room you had to go through the pool area that was always wet and very slippery. The ramp from the entrance into the pool area had so many drink machines next to it there is really only half a ramp that you would be lucky to get a baby stroller up. Upon checkin in I had a special travel agent rate confirmed and I had it in writing. The idiot at the front desk wouldn't even look at it and just said unless I paid 4 times the price I could go elsewhere as they had no intention of honoring it. He said to talk to the manager the next day. That moron also refused to honor the rate even when I told him I had already called the headquarters and had filed a case report on them. Room was barely okay - metal between room and bath was so poorly put in I ripped the side of my foot open on it and there was always a parade of little bugs coming out from under it as it stuck up about 1/2" from the floor. Shower was a walkin but NOT wheelchair accessible as it had about a 5" ledge you had to step over. Also tile was like stepping on ice and is an serious accident waiting to happen (luckily I brought a small bath mat with me). The free continental breakfast was also a joke -- it consisted of nothing but lukewarm coffee and the cups were so small they were like children's Dixie cups. If they put out any food it must have been so little it was gone by the time the first one or two people got there. The ONLY good point was the room maid (I think her name was Cecilia or Celeste) She was great - did a very nice job on the room and was very friendly. She was the only bright spot in a horrible 4 nite stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you're just looking for a place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2003, and had no complaints. From the outset, all I was looking for was: 1) a clean and affordable place to rest my head, 2) a swimming pool, 3) a complimentary breakfast, 4) a free daily newspaper in the morning, and 5) relatively easy access to the Universal Metro Rail station. This hotel satisfied all of my above requirements, though I would preferred a paper other than USA Today. I arrived in LA with a packed itinerary, and was mostly concerned with getting around town and seeing stuff. Whatever the shortcomings of this hotel, it wasn't that big a deal for my purposes. It was clean, quiet and free of cockroaches. (As an aside, I highly recommend the $11 weekly pass from Metro, which allows you to ride any bus or train within the Metro system. From this hotel, you're about a five or ten minute bus ride from Universal station. Once at Universal, the trains can take you to various far-flung corners of LA faster than you would in a car. Also, I found the Metro organization very helpful in my pre-planning. I requested a system map in the mail, and they sent me a gargantuan-sized package that greatly increased my knowledge of the routes I'd need to take.)

Reviews.Title: “They won't honor the internet rate.”
Reviews.Author: doctorfloyd
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation that we booked on Days Inn's site. We got there at 2 AM and there was no parking (the parking lot is a joke). The guy at the front desk told us the rate was $15.00 more a night than what we booked online. He wouldn't honor the online rate. He said we could talk to the manager in the morning. Needless to say we didn't stay there strictly on principle. I don't appreciate being taken advantage of and I won't give my money to someone who even makes the attempt.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Bella526
Reviews.Content: As a previous poster said; "You get what you pay for." We were visiting someone in the area for 2 nights and chose this hotel over another, more expensive hotel in the area. Both were rated as 2 star hotels...so we figured we'd try this Days Inn. We just wanted a place to sleep, didn't need any amenities...and didn't get any. The 1st night was horrific. The rooms have a terrible chemical odor that smell like cleaning chemicals that are attempting to cover up other musty odors. The rooms surrounding ours must have sent out flyers to announce their party as there was loud music, shouting, banging, blaring TVs etc going until 5 AM. The only positive note is that the management profusely apologized for the noise and moved us to another room. The second room also had the same off odor. If you have a choice, you may want to look to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “censored Internet and did not reply to letter of inquiry”
Reviews.Author: djhighmass
Reviews.Content: 1.The room had a cob-web dangling from the main interior light. 2.The bathroom was lit by a florescent lamp that was flickering rapidly enough to induce a headache. 3.The plug socket near the bed has come out of the wall and is loose. 4.I had to contact reception twice during my stay to have the wireless internet router turned on. 5.During the times that the Internet was working, the signal strength was very, very low in spite of the fact the reservation specifically requested wireless Internet. 6.During the times that the Internet was working, several of the websites I attempted to visit were blocked allegedly for â€œpornographyâ€�. I specifically assert that those websites were not pornographic, but even if they were, I question whether the hotel should be censoring websites. I wrote to Days Inn on October 24, 2005 with these points and requesting a reply to point 6. As of 15 November 2005 I had not received any response.

Reviews.Title: “very distateful stay”
Reviews.Author: banjogal
Reviews.Content: Booked a night at this Days Inn, through AAA. Liked the rate, but as they say, you get what you pay for. For some reason our room had the most pervasive musty/moldy odor I have ever experienced in the West. Perhaps the room has had a history of being flooded. They tried to mask the musk with various sickeningly sweet scents, but it only made the room smell even worse. To add to the problem, the main window would not open. We kept the door open as long as we could with the air going, but were very uncomfortable even as we slept, and got up at 6 am so that we could air ourselves out and try to change rooms. I had to wash all my clothes, even those in my suitcase, as everything took on this strange awful odor. I got sick about 3 days later, the first time in 3 years. Whether it was coincidence or not I could not say. The management was ok, but not really interested in our complaint about the room's terrible odor and no other room was available there. One other odd thing about the place is that it has a u-shaped driveway that goes around the rear of the complex. The 'exit' is padlocked shut, so if you have a large vehicle and the lot is busy, you have to back all the way around and out of the driveway. Just an extra irritant to an uncomfortable stay and I wonder about the fire safety of such an arrangement, as there is only one driveway in and out of this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, budget price”
Reviews.Author: travellingalone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from May 17th-24th, on vacation the area was so nice, north of the Hollywood Hills. A single woman travelling alone, I felt this location was safe enough that I could walk to restauraunts nearby. Casa Vega and Ahi Sushi were just two of the nice places I walked to in the evening. There is a Ralph's across the street if you prefer groceries and tons of eateries, Starbuck's, clothing stores, etc. My room was what I had reserved, the bathtub faucet dripped but, I could not hear it unless I was in the bathroom. Hey, I am not paying the waterbill. The staff was very pleasant each time I asked a question or directions, even when I locked my key in the room. The only thing that did disappoint me was the website showed safety deposit boxes and that was untrue. I prefer to lock cash and extra credit card, id in this so I was upset. So, for the price this hotel was exceptable for a budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but check the drawers”
Reviews.Author: Kahuna-Mocha
Reviews.Content: Opinions should be written in the coolness of reflection, not the heat of understandable upset. There is no mention of a free airport shuttle on the motel's website and so I arrived in a rental car. My stay was in December and so I did not bring my bathing suit, not expecting a budget motel's pool to be heated. On the one morning of my stay I was especially hungry, I availed myself of the spartan continental breakfast and was satisfied. Again, to leave something important and valuable in a drawer is bound to cause worry and anxiety, but for goodness sakes don't expect Waldorf customer service at a budget motel.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Staying Here! Horrible Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: cosette13
Reviews.Content: I will first say this place is clean and comfortable and quite central to where we needed to be (we had an event to attend just down the road). They offer a very basic cont. breakfast of coffee, orange juice, tea, packaged danish (that they keep frozen and put out partially thawed as needed), frosted flakes and cheerios. Here are the problems: 1. They advertise an airport shuttle on their website. I got off a 5 hour plane trip with my 8 yr old at 8pm, call the hotel for the shuttle, only to be told "Oh no we have no shuttle - you take taxi cab" and got hung up on. The cab ride cost me $27!!!! I was not impressed. One of the reasons I chose this place was because of the 'free shuttle' offered on their website. I have since found out via the head office that I can get reimbursed for my return taxi fare because it was false advertising on the website. I have to now file a claim for the money back. 2. The pool is FRIGID. They do not heat it. It also is only open 9am-9pm. After a long day of travelling, we arrived at the motel at 845pm. My daughter desperately wanted a quick swim. They locked the pool at 9pm and would not allow her to have even a 5 minute quick dip - in which we promised to be very quiet. Nope. No way. There were kids running around until 11pm each night making noise, yet they could not have the pool open until 11pm. Made no sense to me. We later found out how cold the pool was, so she probably would not have gotten in that night anyway, but its principle. 3. The front desk clerk must be the owner. He is always there. He is also very rude and doesn't crack a smile. When I checked in I paid with traveller's checks. He held them up to the light and was inspecting them like I was giving him counterfeit money, and made me feel very uncomfortable. He then wanted nearly every piece of id that I own and did mention he 'prefers' cash. I am sure he does, but 'I' prefer travellers checks. I never give a credit card at places like this because it never fails that charges seem to get added on somehow and you have to fight to get the money back. 4. After our 2 days in Studio City, my daughter and I headed to Disneyland. We did this via amtrak (no rental car). Once in Anaheim I realized that I had forgotten to get a couple things out of a drawer. One of them being my $300 prescription. Due to long distance charges, I quickly called my mom (who lives in Vancouver), who in turn said she would handle it for me so we could go have fun in Disneyland. Off we went to Disneyland thinking that the motel would stick the few small things (some hair clips, the pills and a bracelet) in the mail, and I would pay the postage. I checked in with my mom later on and she was livid. She said that the man refused to mail these items to us. He said that things left behind had to be picked up only, or they became his property. I had no way of getting back to that hotel at that point. I did not have a rental car, and was quite stuck. My mom had said to him that we would pay the postage and even send a self addressed envelope, but nope....he would not do anything about it. He was rude and arrogant and I think he was looking to keep my stuff. We had been at the motel with a couple of other families who were checking out that day, so my mom asked if they were still there. He said 'I cannot give you that information'. She then asked what was there besides the pills and hair clips and he said 'I cannot give you that information'. We looked into having the stuff fedexed to us in Anaheim, and it was going to cost about $50. I was willing to pay this at that point (as I needed my prescription), but he said he would not package it up for fedex. He said it must only be picked up in person. Luckily, my mom runs a HUGE and very popular discussion board on the internet and asked if anyone lived near this motel. Someone replied that they indeed did, and was able to go and retrieve my belongings, which are now in the mail to me. I have never left anything behind at a motel before, and I have sure learned my lesson to not do that again. 5. Website claims to have microwaves in some rooms, yet in the 7 rooms that our party occupied, not one of them had one. 6. Website claims that there are morning newspapers delivered to all rooms and that was not the case. I do not really care about it, but thought I would point it out if that is important to someone. 7. Website claims to have iron/ironing boards in the rooms (which is something I could have used - ended up steaming my clothes by turning the shower on hot and closing the door), and there were none available. 8. Blow dryer did not work, and when I asked for a new one I was told to keep trying the one we had. Took me 3 tries to get a new one. I will NEVER stay at this place again. Yes, it was clean, close to things (there is a strip mall and a Ralph's across the street with lots of dining choices...bagel place, mexican fast food place, starbucks,etc...), but I would rather give my money to a motel that deserves it and treats customers properly. Customer service is worth a couple of extra bucks to me. Also, with the money I spent on the taxi, I could have used that money to upgrade to a nicer hotel that was one block down that did offer a free airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Close, Clean, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNative
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn is very ordinary, but well-kept and clean. It's an excellent value and well-located for tourists to Los Angeles. Nothing fancy, but nice.
